info.title: Twilio Communications API
info.description: A comprehensive communications API for connecting people through software.

tags.name: Contacts
tags.description:
*Use `Contacts` to build and maintain a reliable directory of customers
with validated communications addresses and identity profiles.*

tags.name: Audiences
tags.description:
*Build up `Audiences` to broadcast communications to larger audiences*.

 - Leverage them with `Messages`, `Emails`, `PushNotifications`
    and `Communications`.

tags.name: Engagements
tags.description:
*Use `Engagements` to track interactions and meaningful connections between a brand and its Contacts.
Engagements are actions performed by the customer of a brand that correlate to a positive interaction.*

- For example, a link click is one of the most common engagement that Twilio tracks. Engagements are used to measure
the effectiveness of a communication and to understand the customer's behavior.

- Actions taken by end-users on communications you send generate Engagements, e.g. email_open, but the Email itself
  and events generated by Twilio, such as the send of a message or an email, are not considered Engagements.
  Engagements are end-user driven, resulting from the end-user's interaction with the communication.

tags.name: Messages
tags.description:
*Use `Messages` to send and receive RCS, SMS and MMS, Group MMS, and WhatsApp messages.*

*Send with precise control over every aspect of your message
 or let Twilio share control and up-level your messaging with data-driven optimizations.*

Messages supports:
 - Sending a Message to a single recipient
 - Sending Messages to many recipients in a single request
 - Sending Group Messages to facilitate communication between multiple people
 - Sending to both stored Contacts and/or directly specified messaging addresses (e.g. phone number)
 - Sending Messages to Contacts with multiple communication addresses: Twilio will choose the best channel.
 - Sending Messages to stored Audiences with per-recipient content personalization
 - Sending Messages with templated content that reference attributes of your stored Contacts
 - Sending Messages with rich content
 - Sending Messages with automatic suppression based on a Contact's preferences
 - Sending Messages with shortened, branded links that support click tracking.
 - Sending Messages scheduled for future delivery.
 - Receiving inbound Messages sent to your Twilio phone numbers.
 - Maintaining history of distinct communication sessions including both inbound and outbound Messages.

tags.name: Emails
tags.description:
*Use `Emails` to send and receive email with Twilio SendGrid.*
*Use `Domains` to verify ownership and configure DNS for your domain name for sending `Emails`.*
*Use `Email Senders` to set up a default address and name to send 'from' and to enable
 email for sending with `Communications`.*

Emails supports:
 - Sending an Email to a single recipient
 - Sending Emails to many recipients in a single request
 - Sending to both stored Contacts and/or directly specified email addresses
 - Sending Emails to stored Audiences with per-recipient content personalization
 - Sending Emails with merged content that reference attributes of your stored Contacts
 - Sending Emails with branded links that support click tracking.
 - Sending Emails scheduled for future delivery.
 - Receiving inbound Email replies and relaying the event to you for handling.

tags.name: Push Notifications
tags.description:
ðŸš§ *Use `PushNotifications` to send push notifications to your mobile apps
via Firebase Cloud Messaging and Apple Push Notification services
as well as other push-enabled services.*

tags.name: Communications
tags.description:
ðŸš§ *Use `Communications` to send and receive communications across all channels of all communication types.
Reach each and every customer with personalized content, on the right channel, at the optimal time, at scale.
Just send it!*

tags.name: Agents
tags.description:
*Use `Agents` to build the sending and receiving identities that represent your business and applications.*

- For 'outbound' communications, it is used as the sender of the communication (`from` field).

- For 'inbound' communications to your app (sent by a Contact/end-user), it is used as the recipient (`to` field).

- An Agent represents existing inventory created and setup in other APIs, such as Phone Numbers.

- Use `AgentPools` to organize your `Agents` into logical groups to build multi-channel identities
with multiple types of communications addresses (phone numbers, short codes, email addresses).

tags.name: AgentPools
tags.description:
*Use `Agents` to build the sending and receiving identities that represent your business and applications.*

- For 'outbound' communications, it is used as the sender of the communication (`from` field).

- For 'inbound' communications to your app (sent by a Contact/end-user), it is used as the recipient (`to` field).

- An Agent represents existing inventory created and setup in other APIs, such as Phone Numbers.

- Use `AgentPools` to organize your `Agents` into logical groups to build multi-channel identities
with multiple types of communications addresses (phone numbers, short codes, email addresses).

tags.name: Domains
tags.description:
ðŸš§ *Use `Domains` to authenticate and manage domain names (via DNS) for sending `Email` and
  for sending branded links  in your communications.*

  *Twilio will generate and manage SSL certificates on your behalf for sending communications
    with branded https links - no proxy required!*

 Domain capabilities include:
  - Configure a Domain with `email` capability to enable creating
    Email Senders that can send 'from' your custom domain name.

  - Configure a Domain with `links` capability to enable Twilio to wrap links in your
    communications with branded links that support click tracking.

  - Use branded links to shorten your original URLs for sending concise `Messages`

  - Use `Engagements` to see how many of your recipients are engaging with your links.

tags.name: Links
tags.description:
ðŸš§ *Use `Links` to shorten long URLs and track clicks for your communications.*

  *Requires Twilio Domain to be configured with `links` capability!*

  Link capabilities include:
  - Create a wrapped URL for a long URL, usually shorter and fits in a message.
  - List wrapped URLs for a given communication.
  - Fetch a wrapped URL by its id.

first_name.description: Match contacts by their first name. This field is fuzzy and case insensitive. If you search for "JohN", you will get "John", "Johnny", "Johnathan", etc. If you search for "tan", you will get "Johnathan", "Stanley", etc. You must specify at least three characters to begin the search.

last_name.description: Match contacts by their last name. This field is fuzzy and case insensitive, so if you search for "cOn", you will get "Conama", "Conan", "Conrad", etc. If you search for "mon", you will get "Montoya", "Lemon", etc. You must specify at least three characters to begin the search.

post.description:
This operation creates an Audience. There are three different types of audiences.
- **Static Audience** - This is the standard type of audience. It is created with a name,
  optionally some tags and then Contacts are manually added or removed from it.

- **Dynamic Audience** - This is an audience whose Contact list is made up based upon a filter.
  The filter is required and the results of the filter are the audience. It is not possible to
  manually add/remove contacts to this audience. When you go to list the contacts on this
  audience they are a close-to-real-time representation of the results of the filter. This means
  that if the audience has a filter where  `favorite_color = 'purple'` and that field is set
  on a new contact it should appear in the audience as soon as possible. The filter for this
  audience is saved on the audience and can be viewed from the API.

  Filters can contain the standard fields: `created_at`, `updated_at`, `addresses.channel`, `location.city`,
  `location.state`, `location.country_code`. Filters can also check for the presence of tags by key
  `Contact.tags = 'NAMER'`, and they can use custom fields that are marked as `is_filterable = true`.


- **Snapshot Audience** - This behaves like the default audience after it has been created, but
  it allows for a powerful way to pre-populate the audience with contacts upon creation.
  This is done by providing a filter when creating the audience and setting the snapshot field
  to true. The contacts that match the filter will be added to the list, but if a contact matches
  later to the filter it will need to be added manually. Contacts can be added and removed manually
  to the list after they have been created. The filter for this audience is not saved on the audience
  as it is a one time operation.

  Filters can contain the standard fields: `created_at`, `updated_at`, `addresses.channel`, `location.city`,
  `location.state`, `location.country_code`. Filters can also check for the presence of tags by key
  `Contact.tags = 'NAMER'`, and they can use custom fields that are marked as `is_filterable = true`.

snapshot.description:
If true, the Audience will be created with the current Contacts that match the filter.
*The audience will not be updated as contacts change in the future and the filter is not saved for reference later.*

post.description: This operation creates and sends out emails to the specified recipients.

from.title: SendEmailsRequestFrom
from.description:
The sending identity to associate with the `Email`.

- Use `EmailAddressSender` to directly specify the email address that the Email
   will appear to come 'from'.

- Use `AgentIdSender` to specify a reference to an `Agent`. 

- `Agents` are automatically created for you for each `EmailSender` you create.

- Leave this field undefined to pick up the `Agent` associated with 
  your configured default `EmailSender`.

to.title: SendEmailsRequestTo
to.description: A list of recipients to send the email(s) to.

content.title: SendEmailsRequestContent
content.description:
The content of the Email.
- Use `EmailContent` to supply a `text/html` email body.
  Optionally provide a `plain/text` body for clients that do not support HTML.
  If none is specified, Twilio will auto-create one from your HTML email body.

- Use `EmailContentTemplate` to reference a stored `Content` template.
***
* Use the [Liquid](https://shopify.github.io/liquid/) templating language for personalization in any text-based field.
* When using a templated content, use the `variables` field on each recipient to specify the values to substitute.
* For each variable you specify in your template, you should have a matching key in each recipient's `variables` object.
* For each variable in your template, you may also specify a default in `default_variables`.
* When targeting an `Audience`, it is *mandatory* to define defaults in `default_variables` for all variables in the template.
* When targeting `Audience` or `Contact` recipients, you may specify `variables` with values that reference stored fields, including custom fields, on the `Contact` -- for example: `${Twilio.Contact.first_name}` or `${Twilio.Contact.my_custom_field}`.

reply_to.title: SendEmailsRequestReplyTo
reply_to.description: A list of recipients to send replies to when the recipient of this email attempts to reply.

cc.title: SendEmailsRequestCC
cc.description:
A list of recipients to carbon-copy ('cc') emails to.
Recipients will have visibility of eachother's addresses.

bcc.title: SendEmailsRequestBCC
bcc.description:
A list of recipients to blindly carbon-copy ('cc') emails to.
Recipients will NOT have visibility of eachother's addresses.

allOf.description: The Domain to use for wrapping links for branded, click-tracked links. If not specified, your default Domain will be used, if available.

use_preference.title: SendEmailsRequestUsePreference
use_preference.description:
Specify the `Preference` that pertains to the content of the Email
- For each recipient, Twilio will reference the Contact's `Preference` to determine whether to suppress or send the Email.
- Use the `Preferences` API to create and manage Preferences.
- Previously referred to as 'asm' and 'advanced suppression manager'.

bypass_preferences.description: Set to `true` to bypass the Contact's Preference and send the Email. This will not update the Contact's Preference.

to.title: SendMessagesRequestTo
to.description:
An array of recipient objects to send the message(s) to.
- Use `AddressRecipient` to describe the recipient by their address.
- Use `ConnectedAddressRecipient` to send a message to a recipient
  with multiple addresses, Twilio will select the optimal channel and perform
  retries across channels (if necessary).

- Use `ContactRecipient` to reference a stored `Contact`.
- Use `ContactRecipientFinder` to reference a stored `Contact` by a field
  other than the `Contact.Id`.

- Use `AudienceRecipient` to send a message to an audience.
- Use `GroupRecipient` for group messaging.

oneOf.title: SendMessagesAddressRecipient
oneOf.description: The address and channel to reach your recipient.

oneOf.title: SendMessagesConnectedAddressRecipient
oneOf.description: A recipient with multiple address for Messaging. Provide a list of addresses for a recipient and Twilio will pick the best one.  Twilio will automatically handle errors and retry across channels if necessary.

content.title: SendMessagesRequestContent
content.description:
The content of the Message.
- Use `MessageContentTextWithMedia` to send a Message with just text and/or media.
- Use `MessageContentTemplate` to reference a stored `Content` template.
- Use `MessageContentChannelModules` to send rich content and 
  different content per channel.

***
* Use the [Liquid](https://shopify.github.io/liquid/) templating language for personalization in any text-based field.
* When using a templated content, use the `variables` field on each recipient to specify the values to substitute.
* For each variable you specify in your template, you should have a matching key in each recipient's `variables` object.
* For each variable in your template, you may also specify a default in `default_variables`.
* When targeting an `Audience`, it is *mandatory* to define defaults in `default_variables` for all variables in the template.
* When targeting `Audience` or `Contact` recipients, you may specify `variables` with values that reference stored fields, including custom fields, on the `Contact` -- for example: `${Twilio.Contact.first_name}` or `${Twilio.Contact.my_custom_field}`.

from.title: SendMessagesRequestFrom
from.description: The sending identity to associate with the Message(s).

oneOf.description:
Define a pool of sender addresses (or `Agents`)
  with optional channel controls to send 'from'.

Twilio will select the best `Agent` 
and automatically handle errors and channel fallbacks.

post.description:
This operation registers the push notifications token of the device/browser to the
Registration set of a Contact with the corresponding `app_name`.

* If a Contact Id is not provided, a new Contact is created. 

* If a Contact Id is provided and the Contact exists, the device is registered to the Contact.

contact_id.description: The Id of the contact to register the device to, if available.

app_name.description:
The name of the `App` to register the device for.

If the `app_name` does not match the name 
  of any existing Push Notification `App`, the operation will fail.

token.description: The device token to register for push notifications.

get.description:
This operation fetches a paginated list of Device Registrations
  with the Id of the `Contact` they belong to and the name of the `App` that they are for.

* A Device Registration contains a list of devices registered for a particular `Contact` under an `App`

* The `Device` tokens in the Device Registration are used for delivering Push Notifications to the given `App` on 
devices or browsers belonging to a single Contact.

* Each Contact will have one Device Registration for each `App`.

* When sending Push Notifications to a Contact, all of the
  devices registered under the Device Registration with the corresponding `app_name`
  are targets for the Push Notification.

parameters.name: contact_id
parameters.description: Filter Device Registrations by `Contact.id` to retrieve only registrations for that Contact.

parameters.name: app_name
parameters.description: Filter Device Registrations by their `app_name`.  Must be accompanied by the `contact_id` query parameter.

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: The token to retrieve the next page of results.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of resources to return in a page.

get.description:
This operation fetches a single Device Registration.

* A Device Registration contains a list of devices registered for a particular `Contact` under an `App`

* The `Device` tokens in the Device Registration are used for delivering Push Notifications to the given `App` on 
devices or browsers belonging to a single Contact.

* Each Contact will have one Device Registration for each `App`.

* When sending Push Notifications to a Contact, all of the
  devices registered under the Device Registration with the corresponding `app_name`
  are targets for the Push Notification.

delete.description:
This operation deletes a Device Registration.

Once deleted, the Contact will no longer receive Push Notifications for the specified App until new devices are registered.

post.description: This operation creates and sends out push notifications to the specified recipients.

from.title: SendPushNotificationRequestFrom
from.description:
The sender of the Push Notification(s).
- Leave unspecified to automatically use the default `App`.

- Use `PushNotificationCredentialSender` to specify `Credential(s)`'
  (one per provider) to be used for sending the Push Notification(s).

- Use `PushNotificationAppSender` to specify the name of the `App`
  to be used for sending the Push Notification(s).

- Use `AgentIdSender` or `AgentIdSender` to send the Push Notification(s)
  from an `Agent` or `Agent Pool`.

app_name.description: The name of the `App` to be used for sending the Push Notification(s)

to.title: SendPushNotificationsRequestTo
to.description: A list of recipients to send the push notifications(s) to.

content.title: SendPushNotificationsContent
content.description:
The content of the Push Notification.
- Use `PushNotificationContentBody` to construct content with body but no images.
- Use `PushNotificationContentBodyWithImages` to construct content with
  body and images.

- Use `PushNotificationContentImages` to construct content with images but no body.
- Use `PushNotificationContentTemplate` to reference a stored `Content` template.
***
* Use the [Liquid](https://shopify.github.io/liquid/) templating language for personalization in any text-based field.
* When using a templated content, use the `variables` field on each recipient to specify the values to substitute.
* For each variable you specify in your template, you should have a matching key in each recipient's `variables` object.
* For each variable in your template, you may also specify a default in `default_variables`.
* When targeting an `Audience`, it is *mandatory* to define defaults in `default_variables` for all variables in the template.
* When targeting `Audience` or `Contact` recipients, you may specify `variables` with values that reference stored fields, including custom fields, on the `Contact` -- for example: `${Twilio.Contact.first_name}` or `${Twilio.Contact.my_custom_field}`.

providers.description:
A list of Push Notification providers to constrain the send to.
Leave undefined to send to all providers.

If a recipient does not have a token for at least one of these `provider`s,
a push notification will not be sent to this recipient.

use_preference.title: SendPushNotificationsRequestUsePreference
use_preference.description:
Specify the `Preference` that pertains to the content of the Push Notification

- For each recipient, Twilio will reference the Contact's `Preference` to determine whether to suppress or send the Push Notification.

- Use the `Preferences` API to create and manage Preferences.

bypass_preferences.description: Set to `true` to bypass the Contact's Preference and send the Push Notification. This will not update the Contact's Preference.

post.description:
This operation creates Credentials for sending Push Notifications. A credential must always be registered under an App.

If an App with the given `app_name` already exists, the credential is added under the App.
Otherwise, a new App with the given name is created.

* There is a limit of 10 Apps per account
  * Creating a credential with a new `app_name` while at the App limit will cause the creation to fail.
* There is a limit of 10 Credentials per App
  * Creating a credential under an App that already has the maximum amount of credentials will cause the creation to fail.

app_name.description:
The name of the `App` that this Credential will be associated with.

Twilio will automatically create a new Push Notification `App` on your behalf
when you create a Credential with a new `app_name`.

The first `App` created will automatically be assigned as the default App.

  - `Contact.location.country_code == 'US' AND Contact.custom_fields.industry IN('Technology', 'Finance')`
  - `Contact.location.country_code == 'EE' AND (Contact.custom_fields.skills IN ='java' OR Contact.custom_fields.employer = 'Twilio')`
  - `Contact.addresses.channel == 'WhatsApp' AND Contact.tags IN('marketing', 'shipping_notifications')`

*Once a filter is set on an audience it can be updated, but it cannot be removed.*

EmailStatus.title: EmailStatus
EmailStatus.description:
The status of an `Email`. The status can be one of the following:
- `scheduled` The `Email` is scheduled to be sent by
  Twilio in the future.

- `queued` The `Email` is queued in Twilio for sending.
- `sent` The `Email` has been sent by Twilio.
- `delivered` The `Email` has been successfully
    delivered to the recipient.

- `undelivered` The `Email` was successfully sent by Twilio
    but has not been delivered to the recipient.

- `opened` The `Email` has been opened by the recipient.
- `failed` The `Email` processing failed inside Twilio.
   Use `GET /Emails/Operations/{operation_id}/Errors` for more details.

- `canceled` The `Email` was canceled via API request.
- `inbound` The `Email` was received by Twilio from an external source.

If an Agent is `activated`, it is available to send Emails.
If an Agent is `deactivated`, it is not available to send Emails.

EmailSender.title: EmailSender
EmailSender.description:
Email Senders are the identity that you send `Emails` 'from'.

For each Email Sender you create, a matching `Agent` will automatically be created as well.

This setup is only required for sending `Communications` that may result in an `Email`.

If you want to send `Emails` directly without specifying the 'from' address,
create an EmailSender with `is_default` set to `true`.

address.description:
The email address you would like to send Emails 'from'.

Note: Each Email Sender must have a unique email address.

name.description: The name you would like to send Emails 'from'.

is_default.description:
If true, this Email Sender will be used as the default sender for all
`Emails` sent from this account when 'from' is not specified
as well as when sending with `Communications`. Setting a record
to true will set any previous default records to false. The first Email Sender
created will default to true even if not specified in the request.

The work maybe be performed asynchronously and the Email Operation resource can be used to track the progress of the work.

EmailOperationStats.title: EmailOperationStats
EmailOperationStats.description:
Represents the stats of a sending operation of one or many `Emails`.
- `total` is the total number of `Email` resources created in the `Operation`.

  * To get the status for each individual `Email`, fetch the `Email` resource:
    `GET /Email/{email_id}`.

  * For `Emails` with multiple recipients, use `Receipts` e.g. `GET /Emails/{email_id}/Receipts`.

- `recipients` is the total number of recipients targeted in an Operation.
- `attempts` is the total number of sending attempts made by Twilio.
- `scheduled` is the number of `Emails` that are scheduled to be sent by
  Twilio in the future.

- `queued` is the number of `Emails` that are queued in Twilio for sending.
- `sent` is the number of `Emails` that have been sent by Twilio.
- `delivered` is the number of `Emails` that have been successfully
    delivered to recipients.

- `opened` is the number of `Emails` that have been opened by unique recipients.
- `undelivered` is the number of `Emails` that were successfully sent by Twilio
  but have not been delivered to the recipient.

- `failed` is the number of `Emails` that failed during processing by Twilio.
  Get `Errors` with `GET /Emails/Operations/{operation_id}/Errors` fore more detail.

- `canceled` is the number of `Emails` that were canceled via API request.

EmailOperation.title: EmailOperation

MessageStatus.title: MessageStatus
MessageStatus.description:
The status of a `Message`. The status can be one of the following:
- `scheduled` The `Message` is scheduled to be sent by
  Twilio in the future.

- `queued` The `Message` is queued in Twilio for sending.
- `sent` The `Message` has been sent by Twilio.
- `delivered` The `Message` has been successfully
    delivered to the recipient.

- `read` The `Message` has been read by the recipient.
- `undelivered` The `Message` was successfully sent by Twilio
  but have not been delivered to the recipient.

- `failed` The `Message` processing failed inside Twilio.
  Use `GET /Messages/Operations/{operation_id}/Errors` for more details.

- `canceled` The `Message` was canceled via API request.
- `group` The `Message` is part of a group communication.
  To get the status for each Recipient of the group communication, use the `Receipts` endpoint
  e.g. GET `/Messages/comms_message_01h2xcejqtf2nbrexx3vqjhp41/Receipts`

- `inbound` The `Message` was received by Twilio from an external source.

MessageOperationStats.title: MessageOperationStats
MessageOperationStats.description:
Represents the stats of a sending operation of one or many communications resources (Messages, Emails).
- `total` is the total number of `Messages` in the `Operation`.

  * To get the status for each individual `Message`, fetch the resource with:
    `GET /Messages/{message_id}`.

  * For group communications, where there is more than one recipient per communication resource
    use `Receipts` e.g. `GET /Messages/{message_id}/Receipts`.

- `recipients` is the total number of recipients targeted in an Operation.
- `attempts` is the total number of sending attempts made by Twilio.
- `unaddressable` is the number of recipients to which no sending attempts were made because
  a valid match could not be found between the available addresses for the recipient (`to`)
  and sender (`from`).

- `scheduled` is the number of `Messages` that are scheduled to be sent by
  Twilio in the future.

- `queued` is the number of `Messages` that are queued in Twilio for sending.
- `sent` is the number of `Messages` that have been sent by Twilio.
- `delivered` is the number of `Messages` that have been successfully
    delivered to recipients.

- `read` is the number of `Messages` that have been read by recipients.
- `undelivered` is the number of `Messages` that were successfully sent by Twilio
  but have not been delivered to the recipient.

- `failed` is the number of `Messages` that failed during processing by Twilio.
  Get `Errors` with `GET /Messages/Operations/{operation_id}/Errors` fore more detail.

- `canceled` is the number of `Messages` that were canceled via API request.

MessageOperation.title: MessageOperation
MessageOperation.description:
A Message Operation represents the aggregate work to be completed for a POST request to the /Messages endpoint.
The work maybe be performed asynchronously and the Message Operation resource can be used to track the progress of the work.

  Twilio in the future.

- `queued` The `Push Notification` is queued in Twilio for sending.
- `sent` The `Push Notification` resource has been sent by Twilio.
- `failed` The `Push Notification` resource processing failed inside Twilio.
  Use `GET /PushNotifications/Operations/{operation_id}/Errors` for more details.

- `canceled` The communication resource was canceled via API request.

PushNotificationOperationStats.title: PushNotificationOperationStats
PushNotificationOperationStats.description:
Represents the stats of a sending operation of one or many `Push Notifications`.
- `total` is the total number of `Push Notifications` in the `Operation`.

  * To get the status for each `Push Notification`, fetch the resource with:
    `GET /PushNotifications/{push_notification_id}`.

- `recipients` is the total number of recipients targeted in an Operation.
- `unaddressable` is the number of recipients to which no sending attempts were made because
  a valid token could not be found in the recipient's `Device Registration` set for the
  `Credentials` or `App` provided.

- `scheduled` is the number of `Push Notifications` that are scheduled to be sent by
  Twilio in the future.

- `queued` is the number of `Push Notifications` that are queued in Twilio for sending.
- `sent` is the number of `Push Notifications` that have been sent by Twilio.
- `failed` is the number of `Push Notifications` that failed during processing by Twilio.
  Get `Errors` with `GET /PushNotifications/Operations/{operation_id}/Errors` fore more detail.

- `canceled` is the number of `Push Notifications` that were canceled via API request.

PushNotificationOperation.title: PushNotificationOperation
PushNotificationOperation.description:
A Push Notification Operation represents the aggregate work to be completed for a POST request to the /PushNotifications endpoint.
The work maybe be performed asynchronously and the PushNotification Operation resource can be used to track the progress of the work.

PushCredentialType.title: PushCredentialType
PushCredentialType.description: The credential types available for PushNotifications.

AccountPushCredentialFlag.title: AccountPushCredentialFlag
AccountPushCredentialFlag.description:
Use this Credential as the default for the Push Notification `App` for the
  given `credential_type` to send Push Notifications. 
If a Credential of the given type doesn't already exist, 
  this Credential automatically becomes the default.

PushNotificationCredential.title: PushNotificationCredential
PushNotificationCredential.description: Credential properties are specific to the channel type and provided by the vendor that supports it.

app_name.description:
The name of the app that this Credential is associated with.
This should be the same value as the `app_name` set when registering devices for the app
with `/PushNotifications/DeviceRegistrations`

related.description: A list of resources that are associated with this Credential.

ApnCertificatePushCredential.title: ApnCertificatePushCredential
ApnCertificatePushCredential.description: Certificate-based credentials are used to authenticate with the APN service before sending a Notification.  It can be acquired from the Apple Developer Portal. Note that certificates have an expiration date and need to be renewed before they expire. Alternatively, you can use APN Signing Key credentials.

certificate.description: The base64 representation of the certificate. Strip everything outside of the headers,  e.g. `-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----MIIFnTCCBIWgAwIBAgIIAjy9H849+E8wDQYJKoZIhvcNAQEFBQAwgZYxCzAJBgNV.....A==-----END CERTIFICATE-----` and encode with base64 encoding.

private_key.description: The base64 representation of the private key. Strip everything outside of the headers,  e.g. `-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY-----MIIEpQIBAAKCAQEAuyf/lNrH9ck8DmNyo3fGgvCI1l9s+cmBY3WIz+cUDqmxiieR\n.-----END RSA PRIVATE KEY-----` and encode with base64 encoding.

ApnSigningKeyPushCredential.title: ApnSigningKeyPushCredential
ApnSigningKeyPushCredential.description: APN Signing Key credentials are alternative to APN Certificate credentials.  COMMS API uses this signing key to create a short-lived JSON Web Token (JWT) that is used to authenticate with the APN service before sending a Notification. Signing Key can be acquired from the Apple Developer Portal.

key_id.description: A 10-character string with the Key Id. It can be obtained from the Apple Developer Portal under the particular private key used to sign the push notification.

signing_key.description: An authentication token signing key, specified as a text file (with a .p8 file extension) that can be downloaded from the Apple Developer Portal.  Paste the base64 encrypted content of the file here.

FcmPushCredential.title: FcmPushCredential
FcmPushCredential.description: FCM credentials are used to authenticate with the Firebase Cloud Messaging service before sending a Notification. COMMS API uses this private key to authenticate with the FCM service before sending a Notification.

private_key.description: The `private_key` field is a JSON object that contains the Google Cloud private key, generated with minimal privileges,  specifically for Cloud Messaging on the Google Cloud Platform. It is recommended to follow the principle of least privilege  when generating this key to ensure security and limit potential misuse. The Google Cloud private key is in a JSON format and must be encoded with base64 before sending.

PushCredentialContent.title: PushCredentialContent
PushCredentialContent.description: Credential properties are specific to the channel type and provided by the vendor that supports it.

PushNotificationAppDefaultCredential.title: PushNotificationAppDefaultCredential
PushNotificationAppDefaultCredential.description: The default Credential for a `credential_type` (provider) for a Push Notification `App`

name.description: The name of the `App`. This is the unique identifier of the `App`.

is_default.description:
Whether this `App` is the default (Push Notification) App for the Account.
The first `App` auto-created is automatically set as the default.
To update the default `App`, use `PATCH /PushNotifications/Apps/{app_name}`.

related.description: A list of resources that are associated with the App.

AgentCommunicationChannel.description:
The medium which a unit of communication is transmitted through.
These are differentiated by a mix of transmission protocol, network controller/owner, endpoint and address model,
as well as the model for content of the atomic unit of communication itself.

AgentCommunicationChannelControl.title: AgentChannelControl
AgentCommunicationChannelControl.description: Define controls to filter and prioritize Agents based on their `channel`.

A list of eligible channels to constrain `Agent` resolution to;
leave undefined to send across all available channels.

Warning: If there is no viable path from any `Agent` to a recipient resulting from
this filter, no communication will be sent to the recipient(s)!

A list of channels and their priority for use. 
Lowest numeric value is highest priority.

The priority of the channel. Lower values indicate higher priority.
For example, a value of `0` indicates the highest priority channel.

CommunicationAgentPoolIdSender.description:
Allows sending across multiple channels using the Agents in the specified Agent Pool.

Twilio will automatically pick the best channel and Agent for each recipient and handle fallbacks.

address.description: The identifier within a channel address space for an actor (e.g. phone number)

CommunicationOperationStats.title: CommunicationOperationStats
CommunicationOperationStats.description:
Represents the stats of a sending operation of one or many communications resources (Messages, Emails, PushNotifications).
- `total` is the total number of communications resources in the `Operation`.

  * To get the status for each individual communication, fetch the communication resource e.g.
    `GET /Messages/{message_id}`.

  * For group communications, where there is more than one recipient per communication resource
    use `Receipts` e.g. `GET /Messages/{message_id}/Receipts`.

- `recipients` is the total number of recipients targeted in an Operation.
- `unaddressable` is the number of recipients to which no sending attempts were made because
  a valid match could not be found between the available addresses for the recipient (`to`)
  and sender (`from`).

- `scheduled` is the number of communications resources that are scheduled to be sent by
  Twilio in the future.

- `queued` is the number of communications resources that are queued in Twilio for sending.
- `sent` is the number of communications resources that have been sent by Twilio.
- `delivered` is the number of communications resources that have been successfully
    delivered to the recipient.

- `opened` is the number of communications resources that have been opened by unique recipients.
    Only `Emails` will add to this count. 

- `read` is the number of communications resources that have been read by unique recipients.
      Only `Messages` will add to this count.

- `undelivered` is the number of communications resources that were successfully sent by Twilio
  but have not been delivered to the recipient.

- `failed` is the number of communications resources that failed during processing by Twilio.
  Review the `error` field on the communication resource for more details.

- `canceled` is the number of communications resources that were canceled via API request.

CommunicationOperation.title: CommunicationOperation
CommunicationOperation.description:
An Communication Operation represents the aggregate work to be completed for a POST request to the /Communications endpoint.
The work maybe be performed asynchronously and the Communication Operation resource can be used to track the progress of the work.

AgentStatus.title: AgentStatus
AgentStatus.description:
The status of an Agent.
If an Agent is `activated`, it is available to send and receive communications.
If an Agent is `deactivated`, it is not available to send or receive communications.

Agent.title: Agent
Agent.description:
an Agent is a sending and receiving communication identity associated with a Twilio application.
For 'outbound' communications, it is used as the sender of the communication in the 'from' field.
For 'inbound' communications (sent by a Contact/end-user), it is used as the recipient and populated in the 'to' field.
An Agent represents existing inventory created and setup in other Twilio APIs, such as Phone Numbers.

display_name.description:
The name associated with the address inventory.

It may be visible to your communication recipients for some types of communications like `Email`.

To modify this value refer to the Twilio APIs that govern the type of inventory.

For an `Agent` with channel `email`, use the `EmailSenders` API to modify this value.

address.description: The identifier within a channel address space for an actor (e.g. phone number)

AgentPool.title: AgentPool
AgentPool.description:
An AgentPool is a set of sending (and receiving) identities associated with a Twilio application.
It can contain one or more Agents for use in multi-channel use-cases or to achieve pooling functionalities.
For 'outbound' communications, it is used as the sender of the communication in the 'from' field.
For 'inbound' communications (sent by an Contact/end-user), it is used as the recipient, and populated in the 'to' field.

AgentPoolOperation.title: AgentPoolOperation
AgentPoolOperation.description:
An AgentPool Operation represents the aggregate work to be completed when creating and modifying AgentPools by adding or removing Agents.
The work maybe be performed asynchronously and the Agent Pool Operation resource can be used to track the progress of the work.

DomainName.title: DomainName
DomainName.description: A fully qualified domain name (FQDN) that you have registered with your DNS provider.

DomainCapabilityLinks.title: DomainCapabilityLinks
DomainCapabilityLinks.description: The Domain capability for wrapping links in communication content with branded and shortened links (where applicable) and with click tracking support.

is_default.description: Whether this Domain is the default for the type of capability for the account.

fallback_url.description: The URL to redirect end-users to if they click an expired branded link. Defaults to the root domain.

DomainCapabilityLinksResolved.title: DomainCapabilityLinksResolved
DomainCapabilityLinksResolved.description: The Domain capability for wrapping links in communication content with branded and shortened links (where applicable) and with click tracking support.

certificate.title: LinksCertificateMetadata
certificate.description:
The metadata for SSL certificate auto-provisioning. 
- Twilio will auto-provision an SSL certificate for serving branded https links with your
`Domain`. 
- The certificate will be automatically renewed and managed by Twilio.
- Check the `status` and `error` fields for the current state of the certificate.

status.description:
The current status of the SSL certificate auto-provisioning.
  - `provisioned` - The certificate is successfully provisioned and active.
  - `provisioning` - The certificate is in the process of being provisioned.
  - `renewal_failed` - The certificate renewal failed. 
      If this continues, the certificate will expire at `expires_at`. 
        Check `error` for more info.
  - `expired` - The certificate has expired because auto-renewal failed.
  - `failed` - The certificate provisioning failed. 
    Check `error` for more info.

expires_at.description: The date and time the certificate will expire.

DomainDNSRecord.title: DomainDNSRecord
DomainDNSRecord.description: A DomainDNSRecord is used to configure the DNS records for a domain with your DNS provider.

role.description:
- `verification`: Used by Twilio to verify that you have control of the domain name.
- `links`: Enables all links in your communications with Click Tracking enabled to use your domain in the URL instead of twilio.com.  Click Tracking allows you to have Twilio wrap links contained in your communications so that you can track when a Contact clicks on a link.
- `dkim`: DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM) allows the receiver to check that an email that claimed to have come from a specific domain was indeed authorized by the owner of that domain.  Enables Twilio to manage DKIM signing for your domain. Supports the `email` capability.
- `dmarc`: Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting, and Conformance (DMARC) is an email authentication protocol that is built on top of SPF and DKIM.  Supports the `email` capability.
- `spf`: Sender Policy Framework (SPF) is an email authentication method designed to detect forging sender addresses during the delivery of the email.  Enables Twilio to manage SPF for your domain. Supports the `email` capability.

type.title: DomainDNSRecordType
type.description: The type of DNS record. Valid values are `txt`, `cname`, and `a`.

host.description: The host name for the DNS record. This is the value of the 'host' field in the DNS record that you will add to your domain with your DNS provider.

value.description: The value for the DNS record. This is the value of the 'value' field in the DNS record that you will add to your domain with your DNS provider.

is_verified.description: The verification status of the DNS record. A Domain must be verified before it can be used to send Email or to wrap links contained in your communications when using click tracking.

last_verify_attempt_at.description: The date and time that Twilio last attempted to verify this DNS record. This field is null if no attempt has been made to verify the DNS record.

updated_at.description: The date and time the `value` field was last updated.

Domain.title: Domain
Domain.description: A Domain can be used to send Email and to wrap links contained in your communications when using click tracking. It references a domain name that you control and contains the unique values needed to be configured as DNS records with your DNS provider so that you can use your domain with Twilio.

domain_name.description: The domain name that you control for your web property. This is the domain name that you will add records for with your DNS provider.

sub_domains.title: DomainSubDomains
sub_domains.description: The subdomains of the Domain. For example, the subdomains of `example.com` are `sub1.example.com` and `sub2.example.com`.

capabilities.title: DomainSubDomainCapabilities
capabilities.description: The capabilities that the sub-domain has been configured for.

is_ownership_verified.description: Whether the Domain has been verified as being owned by you via DNS verification. This is required before you can use the Domain with Twilio.

capabilities.title: DomainCapabilities
capabilities.description: The capabilities that the Domain has been configured for.

dns.description: The DNS records that you need to configure with your DNS provider to support the listed `capabilities` of the Domain.

created_at.description: The date and time the Domain was created.

updated_at.description: The date and time the Domain was last updated.

deleted_at.description: The date and time the Domain was deleted.

Link.title: Link
Link.description: A Link is a short URL that can be used to redirect to a long URL.

id.description: The unique identifier for the Link.

wrapped_url.description: The short URL for the Link.

original_url.description: The long URL for the Link.

operation_id.description: The operation id for the Link.

contact_id.description: The contact id for the Link.

communication_id.description: The communication id for the Link.

created_at.description: The date and time the Link was created.

expires_at.description: The date and time the Link will expire.

Http400Response.description: This error indicates that the request content was malformed or ambiguous.

Http429Response.description: This error indicates that you have sent too many requests to the API. You should retry according to the `Retry-After` response header.

errors.message: Too many requests. Please retry according to the Retry-After response header.

Retry-After.description: The amount of time in seconds that the customer should wait before issuing a new request towards the API.

Http500Response.description: This error indicates that the Twilio API is experiencing server-side issues. The request should not be retried.

Http503Response.description: This error indicates that the Twilio API is temporarily unavailable.  You should retry according to the `Retry-After` response header.

Retry-After.description: The amount of time in seconds that the customer should wait before issuing a new request towards the API.

Http202ResponseWithOperation.description: The request was accepted and an Operation was created to track its progress. The response headers contain the Id and link to the Operation resource.

Http404Response.description: This error indicates that the requested resource was not found.

Http202ResponseWithResource.description: The request was accepted and a resource identifier is available to check the result. The response headers contain the identifier and link to the resource.

OperationLocation.description: The location (uri) of the Operation resource identified by `Operation-Id`.

OperationId.description:
Th Operation Id is an identifier that can be used to correlate all of the resources created in a request.
Issue a GET request to the resource list location, using the Operation Id as a filter
to retrieve a list of the created resources and an aggregate status.

ResourceLocation.description: The location (uri) of the resource identified by `Resource-Id`.

ResourceId.description:
Th Resource Id is an identifier for the resource that was created or updated
  in response to the request.

Use the `Resource-Location` header to retrieve the resource.
